summary: empty() returns true when the input collection has no items; otherwise false.
exists() returns true when the input collection has any items; otherwise false.
exists() is the opposite of empty() and is shorthand for empty().not().

todo: [ ] Implement empty() on collections (true for {}, false otherwise).
[ ] Implement exists() on collections (true for non-empty, false for {}).
[ ] Add criteria-based tests once where() is supported.

cases.name: empty on missing field returns true
empty on empty array returns true
empty on non-empty array returns false
exists on missing field returns false
exists on empty array returns false
exists on non-empty array returns true
empty on scalar value returns false
exists on scalar value returns true
